meanings.definition: The quality or state of being automatic.
meanings.sent1: Her automaticity in solving math problems impressed her teacher.
meanings.sent2: The automaticity of the machine made the task much easier.
meanings.sent3: His automaticity in remembering people's names was like a superpower.
meanings.sent4: The automaticity of the clockwork mechanism was mesmerizing to watch.
meanings.sent5: The automaticity of the car's engine made it a joy to drive.

meanings.definition: The ability to perform a task without conscious effort.
meanings.sent1: The pianist's automaticity in playing complex pieces amazed the audience.
meanings.sent2: Driving to work had become automaticity for him after years of practice.
meanings.sent3: Her automaticity in parallel parking was so reliable it was almost comical.
meanings.sent4: The automaticity with which he solved puzzles was like watching a magician at work.
meanings.sent5: The automaticity with which the dancer moved across the stage was breathtaking.

meanings.definition: The process by which a behavior becomes automatic through repetition.
meanings.sent1: The athlete's automaticity in shooting free throws was a result of hours of practice.
meanings.sent2: Learning to ride a bike involves developing automaticity in balancing.
meanings.sent3: His automaticity in tying shoelaces was like watching a robot in action.
meanings.sent4: The automaticity of muscle memory kicked in during the performance.
meanings.sent5: The automaticity of her daily routine made each day feel seamless.
